project.name: WagWalk
project.description: A premium, trustworthy, and energetic dog walking and pet sitting platform.
project.target_audience: Pet owners who treat pets like family; Professional walkers who need efficiency.
project.theme_strategy: Light Mode Default (Warm/Organic) with Dark Mode Option

grid_strategies.dashboard: Control Room Mode B (Dense, 'Control Room' Grid)

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 rounded-full shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl transition-all duration-300 font-bold px-8 py-3
buttons.secondary: bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/90 rounded-full shadow-md hover:shadow-lg transition-all duration-300 font-semibold px-6 py-2

cards.marketing: bg-card text-card-foreground rounded-3xl shadow-xl border border-border/50 hover:-translate-y-1 transition-transform duration-300 overflow-hidden
cards.dashboard: bg-card text-card-foreground rounded-xl shadow-sm border border-border hover:shadow-md transition-shadow duration-200

inputs.default: rounded-lg border-border bg-background px-4 py-3 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-primary/20 transition-all

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle grain/noise overlays on solid backgrounds to avoid 'digital flatness'.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Soft, colored shadows (e.g., shadow-orange-500/20) for primary actions.
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use backdrop-blur-xl with bg-white/70 for sticky headers and floating navs.
visual_enhancers.motion: Use framer-motion for entrance animations (staggerChildren). Hover states must be snappy (duration-200).

icons.instructions: Use Lucide icons for all UI elements. For marketing sections, use larger sizes with colored backgrounds.

universal_guidelines: DO NOT use generic 'Inter' font for headings.
Ensure contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Install fonts: `npm install @fontsource/nunito @fontsource/manrope @fontsource/fredoka`. 2. Update `tailwind.config.js` with the provided colors and fonts. 3. Create a `Layout` component that handles the sidebar/header structure. 4. Use the provided image URLs for placeholders. 5. Follow the 'Bento' grid strategy for the dashboard overview.
